function SetStyle(style as string) rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------- rem define variables dim document as object dim dispatcher as object rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------- rem get access to the document document = ThisComponent.CurrentController.Frame dispatcher = createUnoService("com.sun.star.frame.DispatchHelper")
rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------- dim args1(1) as new com.sun.star.beans.PropertyValue args1(0).Name = "Template" args1(0).Value = style args1(1).Name = "Family" args1(1).Value = 2
dispatcher.executeDispatch(document, ".uno:StyleApply", "", 0, args1())
args1(1).Value = 1
dispatcher.executeDispatch(document, ".uno:StyleApply", "", 0, args1())
rem --- seeing if this does anything args1(1).Value = 3 dispatcher.executeDispatch(document, ".uno:StyleApply", "", 0, args1())
rem --- it seems if both 3 and 16 "styles" are applied, this breaks li p styles rem --- (li p styles get preceding list styles which means double indent, numbering etc.) rem --- but if just one (either one) are applied, then it's ok rem --- args1(1).Value = 16 rem --- dispatcher.executeDispatch(document, ".uno:StyleApply", "", 0, args1())
rem TODO try applying list style as well Family=3?
end function
